replies.bodyText: The client in the ESRestTestCase base class is created on @before, so this is done in order to get the initialized client but still synchronize the setup and do it once in case the tests are run in parallel.
replies.author: aleksmaus

timeline.body:
You could use the approach used in SQL:https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/8279f82dea4d80e138841de1e9f8da724af4b313/x-pack/plugin/sql/qa/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/xpack/sql/qa/jdbc/SpecBaseIntegrationTestCase.java#L60, that is on each test check whether the index exists - if it doesn't load the data, otherwise ignore it.

And wipe the data in a `@AfterClass`. Note that you could do the loading inside `@BeforeClass` as well if there are no modifications to the index at all.
